summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from September 4, 2019, discussing a New York Post article titled 'John Doe begs judge not to name names in Epstein gal pal case.' FBI personnel in New York and CID are trying to identify the anonymous 'John Doe' mentioned in the article, anticipating questions about his identity.

persons.name: SSA - FBI New York
persons.context: The sender of the final email in the chain, indicating they had already reached out to someone referred to as 'M' about identifying 'John Doe'.

events.title: Publication of NY Post article on John Doe
events.description: The New York Post publishes an article titled 'John Doe begs judge not to name names in Epstein gal pal case.'

events.title: FBI internal discussion on John Doe identity
events.description: FBI personnel exchange emails trying to identify the 'John Doe' mentioned in the news article, anticipating questions about him.

keyFacts: An anonymous 'John Doe' is petitioning a judge to not reveal names in a case related to an Epstein 'gal pal'.
The FBI was actively trying to identify this 'John Doe' in September 2019, indicating official interest in the figure.
The communication shows the FBI anticipating public or media questions about the individual's identity.
The document is an internal FBI email chain, highlighting operational coordination following media reports.
